raw_text: We suggest that alignment constraints such as this one can be used to define most of the possible syntactic divergences between languages (Dorr, 1994), and that only a handful of them are necessary for two given languages (we have identified 11 general alignment constraints necessary for Korean to English transfer so far)
clean_text: We suggest that alignment constraints such as this one can be used to define most of the possible syntactic divergences between languages (Dorr, 1994), and that only a handful of them are necessary for two given languages (we have identified 11 general alignment constraints necessary for Korean to English transfer so far).

raw_text: Dorr (1994) categorizes sources of syntactic divergence between languages, and Fox (2002) analyzed a parallel French-English corpus, quantifying how often parse dependencies cross when projecting an English tree onto a French string
clean_text: Dorr (1994) categorizes sources of syntactic divergence between languages.

raw_text: Yet, we can not preclude divergence from translational correspondence; on the contrary, it occurs routinely and to a certain extent systematically (Dorr, 1994)
clean_text: Yet, we can not preclude divergence from translational correspondence; on the contrary, it occurs routinely and to a certain extent systematically (Dorr, 1994).

raw_text: However, structural divergences between languages (Dorr, 1994)? which are due to either systematic differences between languages or loose translations in real corpora? pose a major challenge to syntax-based statistical MT. As a result, the syntax based MT systems have to transduce between non-isomorphic tree structures
clean_text: However, structural divergences between languages (Dorr, 1994) which are due to either systematic differences between languages or loose translations in real corpora pose a major challenge to syntax-based statistical MT.

raw_text: Dorr (1994) presents some major lexical-semantic divergence problems applicable in this scenario: (a) Thematic Divergence In some cases, al though there exists semantic parallelism, the theme of the English sentence captured in the subject changes into an object in the Urdu sentence (Example 1)

raw_text: In particular, knowing a little about the structure of a language can help in developing annotated corpora and tools, since alittle knowledge can go a long way in inducing accurate structure and annotations (Haghighi and Klein, 2006) .Of particular relevance to MT is the issue of struc 452tural divergence (Dorr, 1994)
